duck: Pragmatic maxim - The pragmatic maxim, also known as the maxim of pragmatism or the maxim of pragmaticism, is a maxim of logic formulated by Charles Sanders Peirce.

Operationalization - In research design, especially in psychology and other social sciences, operationalization is the specification of empirical indicators (i.e., measures) of a latent phenomenon that is not direct...
A statement of the meaning of a word, phrase, or term, as in a dictionary entry.

Pragmaticism - Pragmaticism is a term used by Charles Sanders Peirce for his pragmatic philosophy starting in 1905, in order to distance himself and it from pragmatism, the original name, which had been us...
Pragmatism - Pragmatism is a philosophical tradition that began in the United States around 1870.

wiki.text:
An 'operational definition', also called 'functional definition',<ref>Adanza,
Estela G. (1995) [http://books.google.com/books?id=yNmTHbQiPEUC&pg=PA21
Research methods: Principles and Applications] p.21</ref><ref>Sevilla, Consuelo
G. et al. (1992) [http://books.google.com/books?id=SK18tR3vTucC&pg=PA20
Research methods], revised edition p.20</ref> is a result of the process of
operationalization and is used to define something (e.g. a variable, term, or
object) in terms of a process (or set of validation tests) needed to determine
its existence, duration, and quantity. Since the degree of operationalization
can vary itself, it can result in a more or less operational
definitions.<ref></ref> The procedures included in definitions should be
repeatable by anyone or at least by peers.

An example of operational definition of the term weight of an object,
operationalized to a degree, would be the following: "weight is the numbers that
appear when that object is placed on a weighing scale". According to it, the
weight can be any of the numbers shown on the scale after, including the very
moment the object is put on it. Clearly, the inclusion of the moment when one
can start reading the numbers on the scale would make it more fully an
operational definition. Nonetheless, it is still in contrast to those purely
theoretical definitions.

 the ingredients, time sequences at which every step should be done, and the
 duration of each step. Simply stating that a peanut butter sandwich might be
 "the result of putting peanut butter on a slice of bread with a butter knife
 and laying a second equally sized slice of bread on top" is only
 operationalized to a degree. Besides such a simple recipe as the one for making
 the sandwich, the sheet music is other example of definitions that are
 operationalized to a certain degree.]]
